CatDescriptText: Mrs. Henrietta Carter, hotel worker, 4411 Chatsworth Avenue was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" Answer reads: "There's no need of staying together if you can't get along.  It's like having a bad tooth.  Why keep it in your mouth if it's going to give you a lot of trouble?"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henrietta Carter wearing dark knit sweater and light colored coat with rounded collar, carrying dark handbag, standing on sidewalk next to stone block wall with flecked granite wainscot with store window
